धर्म एव हतो हन्ति धर्मो रक्षति रक्षितः
तस्माद्धर्मो न हन्तव्यो मा नो धर्मो हतोऽवधीत् ॥

Affiliations

Oct, 2018 — Sep, 2022

Leibniz Universität Hannover, Germany

I signed up for the PhD program in Physics offered by the Institut für Theoretische Physik at LUH with funding from DAAD. I was lucky to have an excellent supervisor in Olaf Lechtenfeld who has helped me write 5 research papers so far. I have successfully defended my PhD thesis based on first 4 of these papers and am currently working on some more interesting problems. I have also attended several conferences and summer schools in and around Germany. The yearly Saalburg Summer Schools have been especially helpful in providing me with a working experience in several research avenues.

Jul, 2015 — May, 2018

Indian Institute of Science Education & Research, Kolkata, India

I enrolled myself in the Integrated PhD program of the Deparment of Physical Sciences at IISER-K in order to get a proper training as far the course-works were concerned. This proved greatly beneficial for me as I was able to complete several courses, including some from the Mathematics department, that were offered by very competent faculty members over an intensive 3 year period. I also further collaborated with Biswajit Chakrabarty by visiting S N Bose Centre during summer breaks to produce 2 more research papers. I graduated from IISER-K with a Masters degree in Physics.

Jul, 2010 — May, 2015

Indian Institute of Technology (BHU), Varanasi, India

I initially joined the 5 year dual-degree (Bachelor+Master) program of the Department of Biochemical Engineering at IIT(BHU) with an aim of persuing research in Biotechnology. It was, however, by the end of the second year that I discovered my passion for theoretical physics. Having already spend 2 years there I decided to stay back and finish the degree program while learning the various physics subjects on my own during spare times. Fortunately, I came in contact with Biswajit Chakraborty during this time with whom I published my first research article .

Teaching

Leibniz Universität Hannover, Germany

  1. I was the teaching assistant for the course Lie groups, Algebra and their Representations conducted by my supervisor, Olaf Lechtenfeld, during the summer semester of 2019. I conducted the exercise sessions and also took a few extra classes. It was a very fruitful experience for me as I learned many new things.


  2. I have also conducted 2 revision courses, which are held near the end of the semester to revise the course contents over an intensive 1 week period. The first one was for the Mathematical Methods of Physics course in the winter semester of 2019-20 and the other one was for the Introduction to Quantum Theory course in the summer semester of 2020.

Indian Institute of Science Education & Research, Kolkata, India

  1. I was one of the teaching assistants for the Intermediate Electricity and Magnetism course conducted by Ananda Dasgupta during the Spring semester of 2017. I was tasked with grading the homework assignments. I also prepared solutions for some of the exercise sheets. This was a fun experience, particularly because of the unique teaching style of the instructor.


  2. I was also the teaching assistant for the Advanced Mathematical Methods of Physics course conducted by Sunandan Gangopadhyay in the Autumn semester of 2017. The course covered several important topics in Topology and Differential geometry. I prepared and graded the homework assignments.

Achievements

I have been very fortunate in that most most of my study/research so far have been financed through scholarships of one kind or another. Below I list the prominent ones:

I was awarded the prestigious DAAD Doctoral fellowship in 2018 for a period of 4 years through a screening process that involved submitting a research proposal followed by a personal interview.

In 2016, I secured the Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) by passing the NET examination conducted bi-annually by CSIR+UGC. This funded my research at IISER-K between Oct, 2016 — May, 2018.

I became a part of the famous Super-30 program in 2009 through a competetive 2-step entrance examinations for an intensive IIT-JEE preparation. It's founder, Anand Kumar, is a wonderful mathematics teacher and is quite well known. Recently, a Bollywood movie based on his biography has been released.

I was amongst the few Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya students who were selected in 2008 for an IIT-JEE (an extremely competetive entrance examination for admission into the premiere Indian Institutes of Technology) coaching program arranged free of cost by Dakshana foundation— a non-profit organisation. I did my partial JEE preparation under the guidance of very good teachers there, but had to leave the program midway due to some personal reasons.
